```{r}
dados_CxLiq_Siafi <- read_excel("data/MCTI_lim_saque_liq_pagar.xlsx", skip = 5)

colnames(dados_CxLiq_Siafi) <- c(
  "codOrgao", 
  "nomeOrgao", 
  "Data", 
  "Item", 
  "Movimento")

dados_CxLiq <- dados_CxLiq_Siafi %>%
  filter(!(codOrgao %in% c("49280", "20502"))) %>% # (1)
  mutate(Date     = if_else(str_sub(Data, 1, 4) == "000/", 
                            as.Date(paste0(str_sub(Data, 5, 8),"-01-01")),
                            dmy(Data))) %>%
  group_by(Date, codOrgao, Item) %>% 
  summarise(Movimento = sum(Movimento)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  unite(classificador, Item, codOrgao, sep = "__") %>% # (2)
  select(Date, classificador, Movimento) %>%
  spread(key = classificador, value = Movimento, fill = 0) %>%
  complete(Date = seq(min(Date), max(Date), by = "days")) %>% # (3)
  replace(is.na(.), 0) %>%
  mutate_at(-1, funs(cumsum(.))) %>% # (4)
  mutate(data_num = factor(paste0(year(Date), # (5)
                                  str_sub(Date, 6, 7), 
                                  str_sub(Date, 9, 10)))) %>%
  gather(c(-"data_num", -"Date"), key = classificador, value = coluna) %>%
  separate(classificador, c("item", "codOrgao"), sep = "__") %>%
  spread(key = item, value = coluna, fill = 0) %>%
  rename(Caixa      = `LIMITES DE SAQUE (OFSS, DIVIDA, BACEN E PREV)`,
         Obrigacoes = `VALORES LIQUIDADOS A PAGAR (EXERCICIO + RP)`) %>%
  mutate(Saldo      = Caixa - Obrigacoes)
```

Gera lista de xts's

```{r}

lista_orgaos <- unique(dados_CxLiq$codOrgao)

gera_xts <- function(orgao) {
  dados_xts <- dados_CxLiq %>% 
        filter(codOrgao == orgao) %>%
        select(Date, Caixa, Obrigacoes, Saldo)
  sh_xts <- xts(dados_xts[,-1], order.by = dados_xts$Date)
}

lista_xts <- lapply(lista_orgaos, gera_xts)
names(lista_xts) <- lista_orgaos

```

## Inputs and Outputs

You can embed Shiny inputs and outputs in your document. Outputs are automatically updated whenever inputs change.  This demonstrates how a standard R plot can be made interactive by wrapping it in the Shiny `renderPlot` function. The `selectInput` and `sliderInput` functions create the input widgets used to drive the plot.

```{r eruptions, echo=FALSE}
inputPanel(
  selectInput("orgao", label = "Órgão desejado:",
              choices = unique(dados_CxLiq$codOrgao), selected = unique(dados_CxLiq$codOrgao)[1])
)

renderDygraph({
  
  dygraph(lista_xts[[input$orgao]]) %>%
      dyHighlight(highlightCircleSize = 5,
                  highlightSeriesBackgroundAlpha = 0.2,
                  highlightSeriesOpts = list(strokeWidth = 3),
                  hideOnMouseOut = FALSE) %>%
      dyAxis("y",
             pixelsPerLabel = 40,
             gridLineColor = "rgb(222,222,222)",
             axisLineColor = "white") %>%
      dyAxis("x",
             pixelsPerLabel = 40,
             gridLineColor = "rgb(222,222,222)",
             rangePad = 5,
             axisLineColor = "white") %>%
      dyLegend(show = "always") %>%
      dyRangeSelector()
})
```
